010059.question: What are your thoughts on the fact that "communism", "socialism" and other left-wing ideologies have been watered down to mean something completely different than what they did originally? I mean, people run around calling The Soviet Union, Mao's China, Cuba and other dictatorships "Communist", but if you actually look into the roots and main principles of communism, it's obvious that these regimes were far from communist. Communism is mainly about DECENTRALIZATION of power, which is completely opposite to what happened in the USSR. So-called communist dictatorships weren't communist, but actually OPPOSITE to being communist. They had massive centralization of power, which is THE OPPOSITE of what real communism calls for! For fucks sake.
010059.answer: if you are bothered when words are hijacked and transformed in the public consciousness, you are in for a real treat if you decide to move to earth full time

010531.question: how to chord progressions
010531.answer: hint: the word 'progression' doesn't mean anything, it is there to throw you off. 'chord progression' just means 'chords.' also don't forget, you might only need 1 chord. you might only need 2. you might need a chord for every single note in the damn song. every situation is different, use your imagination and be reasonable, and remember that the point of the song is not the chords, the point of the song is usually the words, characters, and pictures. i hope that makes sense

010588.question: sorry this is a long/multipart question. i think it's a little silly and maybe a deliberate misdirect to say you don't care about 'politics' or aren't 'political' in some sense, and i think it's pretty clear in many of your videos. i mean, a lot of your videos are about critiquing corporate culture and consumerism by appropriating corporate language and musical techniques and juxtaposing them with surreal or humorous circumstances in order to reveal corporate society's perverse absurdity. take, for instance, your "sponsor movie" video, which involves you scream-singing "coke" for around thirty seconds, which quite pointedly reveals the insane and almost violent aspects of advertising, or "how about going to the mall?" where you sing a fake and repetitive advertisement from "ShitMall", which i feel leaves little to no ambiguity for how you feel about malls and advertising. of course, you've also communicated your anti-advertising and anti-cor porate stances in the past on this very questions page, citing them as a reason why you won't turn on advertising on your youtube videos. there are numerous other examples in your videos: "colonization" has you singing the word "colonization" over the image of a U.S. city skyline, implying that, indeed, the U.S. city is a product of colonization and colonial life; "jazz america" has you improvising over a scrolling neon text of the U.S. declaration of independence, a choice which could have a number of interpretations but isn't exactly politically 'neutral'; the christmas video is another send up of corporatism which encourages viewers to "stay home from work to be with your family" while reassuring them not to worry because "the people that work in the 24 hour stores will still go to work", including the corporate logos of mcdonald's, walgreen's, and *foxconn factories*, highlighting a hypocritical imbalance central to capitalism and consumerism; the japan video take great pains to 'correct' us and inform us that only "rich important people hired samurai. poor people who could not afford to hire samurai did not hire samurai". i am listing/analyzing so many examples in order to illustrate that your interest in the struggles of those exploited by class systems and the absurdity/horror of consumerism/corporatism are continuing, multi-year topics of interest that appear in many of your videos, topics which are hardly that of someone who "do[es] not have any opinion on politics". it's part of why i personally enjoy a lot of your work so much. i can understand wanting to let your work speak for itself, or being coy about your views in order to protect your privacy or to protect against internet backlash... but unless you're being ironic or satirical in your answers below (which is perfectly understandable, many of your videos have ironic and satiric elements) or are using a particularly narrow definition of politics, then i can't quite make heads or tails o f what y our videos and songs say you believe versus what you say you believe. so for the actual questions part: what do you mean when you say you "do not have any opinion on politics"? what is your definition of what is "political" or not? are my interpretations of your videos valid or not, in your view? were you trying to critique corporate culture in some of these videos? if not, if you were "trying" to "do" anything with these videos, what were you "trying" to "do"? are you "trying" to "say" anything with your work at all? what is your view on "interpretation" and criticism in general? how do you feel about your audience trying to "interpret" your work? what are you views on issues of class and the struggles of "the people that work in the 24 hour stores"? thank you for reading and maybe answering this long-winded question. i hope you have a good day.
010588.answer: i think politics is a weird word and i am not sure what it is really supposed to mean i didn't realize that was called politics, i sort of thought politics is like when you care about which of the 2 eligible contestants will win a campaign for presidency, or something like that it's really like if you are on a long car ride and your brother keeps kicking your seat, and he will never, never, never, never stop and also doesn't seem to hear you asking him to stop. it's not so much a political view but more just losing your mind eventually, and drawing interpretive paintings about the eternal kicking wow, what an incredibly thorough, world class, razor sharp, psychiatric-grade analysis. i hope you have an opportunity to do this professionally in some capacity if you don't already i did not know that is called politics. i thought politics was when someone promises that they have the ability to somehow 'fix' those issues i think that is generally a good strategy oh hell yeah 23,000 questions will do that to you i don't have a firm definition of politics, (which is probably why i stay away from it) but from what i can tell it usually means people with great public speaking skills trying to convince audiences to elect them. seems legit, but it is not something i am terribly interested in. if politics happens to be the name of something i am interested in, then i would prefer to call it something different, because it seems like the word politics has come to be associated with failure, confusion, and frustration. ridiculously perceptive and thorough. i am extremely impressed. you might know me better than i do i am glad you put those words in quotes because i usually prefer to let things try to do themselves, and i just go along for the ride i leave it to the interpreter to have a view on interpretation. or better yet, i leave that to the interpretation interpreter. if i spent time thinking about how people think about what i've done, i wouldn't have time to do the work in the first place some people forget that those people are people. in fact many people forget many people are people

010633.question: Hey, "The friend is me" guy here. I never really thought about it in those terms, as far as which thing terrifies me less. Thinking back, I would definitely say that doing shorter things is much less terrifying, and also I can actually DO it in the first place. Longer things sap energy directly out of my soul when I try to do them, and that makes me wonder if I'm doing it wrong. The problem I'm currently having is that while I can make as many short things as I want, they all contain extremely personal info and I do not feel comfortable showing them to most people. I've tried to transition to something that doesn't feel as awkward to share, but I'm afraid that along the way it will all fall apart and I will be buried by the resultant avalanche of crippling self-doubt. My inability to get all this to "click" together is driving me insane. How do I avoid going insane in this way? (sorry for this super-long question btw)
010633.answer: these sound like the thoughts of someone who knows they are supposed to make it. the great news is, you will probably not be able to focus on anything else until you make it. you will spend every day trying to find ways to get this together. there is no escaping the fact that you are going to get it together. just remember that any way is the right way. you should see some of the dumb things i tried when i first started. oh wait, you can because i posted them all online

(one year later) ok great now i have made plenty of short stuff, and i am So done with short stuff, forget the 5-day, time to do long stuff yay. dammit, just got really popular on vine and it's more followers than i've ever seen anywhere, but i was just getting ready to do long stuff. this is awkward the first reason was ready to be obsolete by the time the second reason kicked in, and the second reason became obsolete as soon as i found an equal or bigger following on a platform that allows any time length. i hope that makes sense

010648.question: god damn bill!! you are a Smart and Helpful Boy! I feel like I better understand myself from agreeing or disagreeing with you and then trying to understand exactly why I do, and what that entails. I have a question! You seem to very adamantly hold the perspective that art either can only be made or is best made out of seeking relief from an uncomfortable intensity of personal emotion, such as frustration, sadness, or joy. The intensity drives one to make art, sends one past a "breaking point." In this way, art is a very personal and perhaps not at all altruistic practice. That said, art can have a profound impact on the life of others. I, for example, can claim to have an enriched life because of your work, from your videos to this question page. Should a desire to please or benefit others ever enter the equation in an artistic venture, in your opinion? What if a desire to please others IS that aforementioned strong emotion?

010946.question: What exactly do you feel you half-assed with the Japan video?
010946.answer: well, it was lower production value on a moment-to-moment basis compared to the vines i had been doing in the previous months. the reason is simply because it takes time to do it. you're not going to get a video that's 10 minutes long that has the visual production value of, say, that one that goes "yes i like music" or "gonna figure out what everything means." so i was really doing the graphics much simpler. just dropping images around, etc etc. i was pretty sure the fans were going to be disappointed that it didn't have all the crazy colors all the time. but i had to get the thing done, because i was tired of everyone only knowing me for short 'pointless' stuff, and i needed to show that i was capable of making a longer and more coherent video

010947.question: Sorry this is so long, I've just had a bunch of questions I've wanted to ask and I figured I might as well ask them all at once. From what I gather, the reason you don't collaborate is because you have a specific artistic vision (and a very specific style) for everything you do, and it would be very difficult to get someone else to use the same style or approach your work with the same vision. Is there more to it than that? Is that assumption even partially right? If so, what about collaborating on research for the History of Japan-style videos? I can't see how the style of presenting info would affect it. Is it just trustworthiness? Also, am I right in assuming that one of the biggest priorities when designing this website is making it load as quickly as possible (since you mentioned you don't want to use graphics)? or do you just prefer taking a minimalistic approach only because you like how it looks? Also, if that's the case (minimalism and no graphics), how come you have a PayPal GIF hidden away at the bottom of your main page? Doesn't that run counter to the way you designed nearly every other page of this site? As a side note I love the way this website is designed. Don't worry if someone tells you it's ugly or poorly optimised or whatever, because in terms of just loading time it's the most optimised site I visit, and the style isn't ugly, its just very distinctive and its kinda representitive of the style you use in some videos (and of your preference for how you want to display and sort your work). If someone asks a question with spelling mistakes do you ever correct them? (so that the viewers can understand it) If someone leaves their email or personal info in a question would you/do you ever remove it without their asking? If I wanted to ask multiple questions, would you prefer a huge message like this, or would you rather have someone ask multiple questions seperately? (if it's the second one, sorry!) Thank you for your time!
010947.answer: you might be right it's worse. everyone always feeds you this idea of how sacred and holy collaboration is, (and i agree with it), always pointing to the great collaborations (lennon/mccartney, etc etc etc). so i always believed that that was important. but there's one problem, what if i don't have any friends? what if i just can't seem to meet anyone who wants to spend their life doing the kinds of things that i'm doing? what if everyone around always wants to just, i dunno, go home and watch the oscars or something. what if i really can't find anyone? so i felt sad and guilty for a long time, thinking that you are supposed to collaborate but i just can't find people cuz i'm cursed or something. and then one day, i saw an interview clip from a very famous and well respected songwriter (i wish i could find the clip, i would post a link to it) that said "you know, i don't collaborate well. that's one of the reasons i like songwriting, is because it's something you can do all by yourself." and that is when it became clear. i had already given up on finding collaborators, but seeing that clip was what made me stop feeling bad about it yes it's kind of like making a good window, for your house. does a good window have fun phrases written on it, and cool pictures on the glass? no. the glass is completely clear, so you can see what's on the other side, with vivid clarity. i hope that makes sense no no yes i used to prefer separate, because to answer multiple questions at once requires me to basically write an entire essay re-stating all the questions, and it is cumbersome mainly for the reader. but then i found an easy way to interject answers into the middle of the question, which makes handling multi-part questions much more reasonable

010948.question: if i eat memory foam will i gain more memories?
010948.answer: no. the foam gets the memories, and it is very short term, and it is only physical. and it would only work if you suddenly became twice as big, the foam would stay small, for a few seconds. it is important to remember that more solid non-foam objects have almost infinite physical memory. memory foam is called memory foam to differentiate it from regular foam, which has no physical memory. this also only applies to physical states which are smaller than its resting state. i hope that makes sense

011057.question: Hey Bill, do you have any advice on how I can recognize chords in the songs in The Real Book sixth edition? I never understand what half diminished or what the seventh of a chord is, and I always forget if the seventh is by default minor/a half step down unless stated otherwise.
011057.answer: really simply, here are the rules: Cmaj7 is maj 3, maj 7. so C, E, G, B Cmin7 is min 3, min7. so C, Eb, G, Bb C7 (technically "C dominant 7") means maj 3 and min 7. so C, E, G, Bb Cdim (diminished symbol is a small circle) is probably just 3 notes, min3 and b5. so C, Eb, Gb. Cdim7 is crazy, it's min3, b5, and double flat 7 which would actually just be a six. so in other words, this chord is stacked minor thirds forever. it is sort of a dizzy feeling and was mainly used in like the 1930s i guess? really old stuff etc. C half-dim (a circle with a line through it) is Cdim but a regular FLAT7 not a double flat 7. so C, Eb, Gb, Bb. Another name for this is Cmin7b5 which is a more complicated sounding name, but more clearly states what is actually in the chord. i think realbook usually calls it Cmin7b5. this is the one you will usually see as part of a 2-5 in a minor key. so in the key of Cmin you would commonly see Dmin7b5, G7(b9), Cmin. or something like that. ok that's the general rules, now, rule #2 is, never play the root note in the chord, swap it out and let the bass play it. and also make sure you always change the octave of all the notes so it's comfortable. so for example, play C maj7 like this: C in the bass, then G below middle C, then B below middle C, then E above middle C. and Fmaj7 would be F in the bass, then A below middle C, middle C, then E above middle C. get used to flipping all the chords around so they are comfortable in the middle range, and leave out the bass. step 3 is to vamp through the chord changes in like a simple sort of bossa nova groove, (because it's simple and probably works for anything) no melody, just vamp the chord changes in this way. take your time, and follow the rules. now play every song in the book that way and GET READY TO REALIZE STUFF

011432.question: Why does jerry give George a nickel and two other coins to buy a 50 cent candy bar in a certain episode of Seinfeld, when a nickel doesn't add up with any two other coins to fifty cents?

011534.question: What is something you wonder?
011534.answer: i wonder how people find a reasonable workflow when exporting files out of blender. from what i understand, when you export a file, it drops into a certain folder with no prompt for name or location, and automatically overwrites the previous export. so if you are exporting a lot of files, you have to manually open up a window, and change the name to something else, and also there is NO prompt to warn you if you are about to overwrite. so even if you have the guts to go in and open up the window to choose a new freakin name every time, YOU are responsible for keeping track of what names you have used, or else you risk overwriting a file. the way i see it, there are 2 reasonable ways this could work: number append, or prompt and warn. prompt and warn would be like you have to name the file before save it and if you choose a name that has already been chosen it says WAIT hold on you already named something that. number append would be fine also, that's what cameras do -- it means it never asks you to name your pictures, it just automatically names them with a number after it, 1 number higher each time, so you are never bothered to name your pictures, and never risk overwriting. Now imagine this horrific situation: imagine if your camera names your first picture "picture." and then you take a second picture and it names that picture "picture" also, and deletes the first picture. UNLESS you open up a window before you take each picture and come up with a name before you take each picture, and oh by the way it is not going to warn you if you are choosing a name you have chosen before. so you are responsible for keeping track of what names you have used, or else you risk wiping out previous pictures. From what i can tell, this is the behavior blender uses when exporting files. now i'm sure blender is fine, and many people use it, and i'm sure there is a reasonable way to work on projects and export files on a regular basis and not risk having them be constantly wiped out if you don't manually name them something different each time AND keep a manual running record of all the names you used ..... but i don't know how it would be done. i abandoned that program long ago because of this issue, but it still remains a deep existential conundrum as to how blender users actually would deal with this. that is what i wonder

011537.question: Thanks to earlier questioners, I saw that you'd added more pages to the notebook, and Friday, February 18, 2011 6:46:17 PM has really stuck out in my mind as someone who struggles with unrealistic self-set deadlines and creating longer pieces. Do you feel you've been able to wake up and write "well formed" music now? Basically, is there light at the end of the tunnel - or is the point that the tunnel is good and I should stop fighting it and learn to work with what I have?
011537.answer: i spent most of 2011 trying to learn to use more 'normal' forms. but the overwhelming opinion from the fans was 'no, don't be normal.' they all liked the 'weirder' stuff better. then during 2012-13 i went on a huge writing binge and i began finishing every unfinished thing i had ever written, and also starting many new songs as well, and really was able to combine the best of both ends of the spectrum, and just wrote a huge amount of stuff, and really rounded out my skills. at the end of 2013 i felt totally bulletproof, songwriting wise. and just when i was ready to start recording songs ferociously for the rest of my life, i thought it would be a good idea to start making videos instead

011595.question: Hi Bill, I would like to talk to you concerning your "history of japan" video. Why have you glossed over the atrocities Japan has committed, which are major events in Japan's history? Examples include the Rape of Nanking, the South Korean Comfort Women, and the human testing conducted on Chinese civilians. These are important issues that cannot be forgotten. However, they are not present at all in your video, which has been viewed over 16 million times. This is encouraging the ignorance of the "darker side" of Japan's history. While countries such as Germany have deeply apologized for their war atrocities and engrain these events in teaching history to their students, the Japanese government has refused to apologize and Japanese textbooks are being revised to omit these events. I sincerely believe that you are a very learned and good person, thus I hope that you are aware of this and that with your large following and outreach, I hop e that y ou may also raise awareness of this issue. Japan's war atrocities are not to be glossed over. Happy Chinese New Year.

012131.question: I just saw your video on Japan. You dont seem to have an email so I'll leave it here. You mentioned that Japan "conquered Korea". You should probably change it to "tried to conquer Korea" or get your facts straight. This is a very sensitive topic to this day in Korea. Our national heroes fought for freedom and it wasnt for ignorant meme making fools to make fun of. For you to make a video without stating the facts is blatant disrespect and disregard for the many Koreans that have fought for Korea's independance. Many comfort women are still requesting for an apology from the Japanese prime minister, Abe, an asshole that calls them prostitutes. A country cannot be considered developed if it doesnt owe up to its mistakes. So, in conclusion, fix yours.
012131.answer: i can't change a youtube video. also, once a project is done i don't change it. it is more important to move forward to other projects the video is supposed to be a fun and crazy time. i am sorry if you did not have a good time. hopefully you may like some of my other videos. if not then you don't have to watch them. there are some other channels that go into those issues in more depth. as you may see from my other videos, that is not really what my channel is all about. please stay away from my videos if you don't enjoy them. it is also important to remember that in that particular video, i used a lot of metaphors (like 'ipads' in the year 1000!) so perhaps if i said 'conquer' maybe 'invade' would have been more accurate? again, razor-sharp fool-proof plain facts is not really what my videos are about. check out some of my other videos and i think you will see what i mean. maybe at some point i will make a video about korea that makes the japanese mad. it is not my goal to make anyone mad, i am just trying to make fun videos, but if millions of people see a video, chances are someone might be mad about something and i am sorry that had to be you. but please stay away from the channel if it is not right for you

012419.question: Why would you only release new songs once a week? Does the recording process really take that long or do you have other obligations?

012819.question: Who is the girl you were writing about in the conclusion of the song, "i don't wanna go to school"?

012855.question: What exactly was the process behind editing the reality videos? How exactly did you split up and spend that time over the 3 months or so that you were editing them?
012855.answer: i started going through all the recordings from the beginning and figuring out which parts i wanted to use, and as the project dragged on past 2 weeks, i steadily started to panic more and more and start trying to go faster and faster, skipping more and more, until eventually for the 2014 and 2015 recordings i basically just randomly looked at maybe 1 out of every 20 files and just found bits. as the project dragged on for months, i started really just taking wild stabs in the dark and just taking anything i could find. i originally thought it was going to actually chronical details for making specific videos, etc etc etc. but after 3 months i had no choice but to drastically simplify the project. but the great news is it got done, and at least now something is online

012895.question: If you had to choose between having absolutely perfect pitch but always getting annoyed when someone is out of tune at all, or always being out of tune but being able to enjoy music as you do now, what would you choose? Also, how do you like your eggs? Fried? Scrambled? Boiled? Entirely raw?
012895.answer: i'm not sure you are understanding quite how perfect pitch works. the name of perfect pitch is misleading. it makes more sense to call it 'absolute pitch.' and you don't need to have absolute pitch to know whether something is out of tune with itself. only to know whether it is overall tuned to A=440hz. and whether or not something is tuned to A=440hz does not affect whether or not it sounds 'in tune'. anyone claiming to be annoyed by something because it is not tuned to A=440 is lying, and using it as an excuse to brag that they have absolute pitch. in fact some people even claim things are not A=440 when they actually are, especially nowadays, with most music being made on computers where all the instruments are by default set to A=440

013051.question: How did you go about animating the notation in your classic "the high class stuff"?
013051.answer: i will explain a single page first (the multi-page spread is another issue)... let's say there is just one page of notation, like 8 bars or whatever.... I make the notation in a notation program, and screenshot it. (then i actually make several alignment adjustments in graphics, because notation programs are incredibly finicky, it's easier to adjust things in graphics)... then i save it how i want. then i use graphics to erase the last note (and any chord that goes along with it.) i erase notes on a staff by just dragging empty staff over it. and i "save as" and then add a 1 to the file name. repeat, keep erasing the next note and 'save as'. then you have a stack of files all in order. then import. then allign the timing. it's the exact same way i do text, but with text i type it out and screenshot each frame, and delete words (easier, instead of erasing them). the delete technique would not work in a notation program, because the notes and alignment will change as you delete them. that's why i use graphics. it's not that hard, and i'm not even using a graphics program. just an image preview program, and i'm just copying and pasting boxes. the mccartney video was a bit more ambitious because i wanted to do a steady scroll. so i thought it would be good to make one huge image file that is the entire length of the score. and then do the erase per frame technique.... so then all the frames were huge... and then export that to a really high res video and scroll the video??? i don't remember if this was successful, but you run into major problems when you try to do huge things like that. processing power limitations, etc. Same sort of crisis occured when i was trying to do the zoom out on the japanese army. i ended up having to somehow break the task into smaller pieces. if i recall. i somehow succeeded in getting a steady scroll on the notation, only to find out that it was too hard to read when it's moving like that!! so i ended up keeping it still and then sliding forward page by page. if i had known the steady scroll wasn't going to work, i probably would have broken it into pages from the start

013154.question: Have you ever considered having someone help editing your videos? I mean, if you're happy with the progress you're making right now, an extra pair of hands might get in the way of your creative process. 013186.question: to the person who asked about death being necessary: death by ageing is caused by deterioration of the telomeres that cap chromosomes, which means that eventually the cells aren't able to divide anymore, so they die. it's called cell senescence (and some cells like rat brain cells don't have this problem and they can keep on dividing forever). so it is possible that in the future we could maybe prevent death, by altering DNA so that the telomeres don't go bad. (telomeres shorten after each cell replication). I don't know if you'll post this but I think it's cool info that people don't hear about unless they search for it specifically

013187.question: when you say songs forever, you don't mean the whole rest of your life, right? at what point do you think you'll go back to other stuff? or will it be other stuff all the time once you've finished your song for the week?
013187.answer: like i started trying to write songs in 2007, then i tried some different approaches, then i really started writing a lot more in 2009, then i tried some more approaches, then in 2010 i recorded maybe 5% of the songs i had written, and then kept writing more anyway, and wrote way way more, then in 2011 i decided that the stuff i was writing was cool but way too insane and i should try to do more normal stuff. so in 2011 i wrote a bunch of normal stuff, and recorded maybe 25% of those, then i got bored with normal stuff and wrote more crazy stuff. and finally in 2012 i was like 'what the fuck is going on here i've written so much stuff and i'll never have time to record it all because it takes longer to record than to write and i keep wanting to write more.' so i organized everything i had ever written, and then wrote more. so throughout 2012-13 i wrote like crazy, updating and organizing everything i had written, fixing it, updating it, etc. and in 2013 i was like, ok, wowwww, now i really think i'm a pro writer and i've got so many hundreds of songs written. time to record it and maybe put it online. then i built a webiste. then i filled the website with all the previous recordings, etc. but then i was like, wait hold on, what about videos? i've wanted to do videos for a long time and i bet it would work, and it would be a good way to get people to pay attention to me. so i started making videos on a regular basis for a couple years and also making stupid tweets to attract attention. then the attention came. guess what now it's time to do the songs i mentioned before

013264.question: yesterday I was in the Dollar TreeŞ with my grandma and we were checking out and the cashier looks at me and I'm thinking "what the fuck that guy looks like bill" and I look at his name tag whilst he's is engaged in conversation with my grandma and it says "RYEN" and I'm like thinking... "fuck, this dude is either not bill Wurtz or he's bill Wurtz under cover." And then he looks at me. And I stare at him. And he says "I like your shirt, man. I've listened to Abbey Road so many times. Rock on" and I just keep staring at him and I look to my grandma and to him and I'm sure I looked like I was going insane and then he starts talking again and he's like "I even love that stupid octopuses garden song" and I'm like "bill?" And he's like "what" and my grandma is like "no it was the other guy in the Beatles who wrote that song" and then he gets in an argument with my grandma about who wrote that song and I'm just standing there watching him scan my grandmas adult diapers and scream at her and in my head I'm thinking "THIS IS BILL FUCKING WURTZ or possibly his twin brother that lives in Florida AND HE KNOWS ALL THE SECRETS TO THE UNIVERSE" because he was winning the argument and I assumed he knew everything else as well. and basically: this shook me, bill.
013264.answer: i don't say rock on, and i'm not terribly interested in abbey road. in general, the points of interest for me on that record are 'her majesty,' 'maxwell silverhammer,' 'she came in thru the bathroom window,' 'polythene pam', and the wild items list in the verses (not the chorus) of 'come together'. but unlike ryen, i am not too interested in the entire album

013302.question: Can you drop some more mad hints and give us an idea on how close you are to finishing the new History of [blank] video? The last one that really gave us an idea of the progress you made was a checklist comparing it to the one for history of Japan.
013302.answer: the 'graphics' phase was finished on feb 7. after that, the process is a little bit more confusing to explain. it's a lot of smaller things -- final narration, jingle vocals, editing jingles and narration, mixing, re-alignment to fit final narration timing, and the score. the score is the most subtantial item of all of those, but not as large as 'graphics.' it is hard to exactly explain the process because i have been bouncing around depending on whether it's day or night (vocal recording, etc) and also i was sick and had lingering sick voice for a couple weeks, so during that time i made an early detour into doing the score, somewhere around feb 19. so i basically locked up the narration timing up until 7:50 (that was as far as i had gotten) and started on the score. by the time i reached 7:50 in the score (this was around march 2 i guess), i was able to resume vocals, and was bouncing around between doing jingles and narration. narration is now solidly in place with correct timing, video re-alignment to fit that new timing is done, now starting on the rest of the score, from 8min to the end. once the score is done, it is just the small little tasks like year labels, other labels, graphics adjustments, mixing, etc etc etc but these small tasks tend to fly by very fast, and once the score is done it tends to be a slippery slope to the end of the process. this is what i know from experience on doing the previous long video of this type. i hope that makes sense

013485.question: I know the new vid is comin', so i will ask about something else. peanut butter song: you recorded the jar hits on to a MIDI track and then just moved the notes to form the major and then add 9 chords, right? It seems more practical than just playing chords in sync or trying to re-sync 'em. just that. keep it awesome and hellyeahish.
013485.answer: the song was actually recorded around early 2010. it was called "this song yeah" and it's hardly a song, it's just me slamming a major chord several times in a row. During 2014, as part of the weekly content schedule, one of the videos each week is supposed to be a 'music video' which is when you make a video to go along to a song that's already recorded. so for a thrill, i decided to try an instrumental song. i picked "this song yeah." the idea that worked best was a jar of peanut butter. when the video was done, it only made sense to change the title. most of the time i aim for strict musical accuracy in my videos, because it is usually more thrilling, especially for musician viewers, but in this particular video the notes are ignored. mainly because it is impossible to play a major triad with a peanut butter jar

013486.question: I see a lot of questions asking when is the next "history of" video. But the real question is, do you feel pressured to please the people who are constantly berating you, trying to find out when the video is coming out? Or do you not care what others think, and care only to work at a pace that suits you? Or perhaps a combination of both?
013486.answer: there is pressure from all sides. some people want the video to come out sooner. some people want me to work less, and 'take vacations.' some people want me to give opinions about the latest films and tv shows. some people want me to make more short videos. some people want me to make songs. some people want me to make more journal clips. some people want me to answer more questions. some people think i answer too many questions. some people want me to collaborate with their favorite artists. some people want me to make videos for their business. these are some of the many kinds of pressure i receive on a daily basis but the only kind of pressure i pay attention to is the pressure that was present before any of those, which is whoops i have no social life but my mind has been exploding for as long as i can remember, and it needs to be put on display ASAP in as many ways as possible until people understand

After about 100 songs, if you are still alive, then you can start going back and improving some of them, and by then i think you will have much broader experience of what works and what doesn't, and you will be much better able to hunt down the right solutions for each unique song. improving songs is a tricky game, every song is like a sick baby with its own special disease

013616.question: help! i think of a bunch of new musical ideas when im walking between things and dont have a good way to record it or write it down! how do i remember my ideas for later?
013616.answer: this is very important, because this is usually where a large percentage of your ideas come from, so it is important to have a technique for this. Use a voice memo app (most phones have them) and be quick and professional about how you frame it. establish where the root of the key is, establish where the time is, and correctly count it off, so there is no confusion about where the key and time are oriented. any hints about the groove or tempo are also very helpful, (perhaps compare it to another song's tempo, if that helps) and any other hints about how the idea is oriented in the song ('this is the top of of the chorus' or 'this would the the end title line of a chorus' or 'this would be a verse line' or any other hints you can think of). and if there are any specific chord things, mention that too, like if you know the whole thing starts on the 4 chord, or something like that. but most importantly remember to orient the key (sing a quick do re mi reference or something) and properly count off the time, and sing the thing, preferably a couple of times. overall your total demo + description should be about 15 to 20 seconds

013706.question: Whenever I try to create something artistic and start but get stuck in the middle my mind tends to wander. At first I will be trying to find ideas to advance the project but I then begin to think of other art-ish things that have little or no relation to the project I am currently working on (like going from writing a poem to thinking of musical riffs). 013796.question: I saw your response to that guy on 1.18.17 11:02 pm asking about the real book chords. not having much keyboard experience i thought your idea of just playing all the songs was amazing and i gave it a shot. after playing about 30 of them i have a few questions 1. #9 chords are kind of bothering me. am i supposed to play with the minor second clash right next to each other or spread it out, because it sounds better spread out but a lot of times i can't get to that position fast enough. 2. same for 11s and 13s whats a good way to voice them? 3. i've just been doing block chords so far and that has been challenging enough. How do I play these charts in a more realistic groove (you mentioned bossa nova and I have no idea what that is) 4. what kind of situations do I leave out the fifth? I realized that I specifically always include it but i've heard from other places that its kind of an optional note thanks! already i've been realizing stuff and its amazing
013796.answer: i would say the default way to play, for example, E7#9 would be (listed from low to high) g#, d, g. (left hand takes E, the bass) there are many different types and situations. perhaps you could give me a specific example just play something in time, so you can feel the time. sometimes there's 1 chord in a bar, sometimes there are 2. if you are just playing the chords with no time, then the song won't make sense at all. use whatever groove is the simplest and most comfortable for you, but also doesn't bore you just try and see what works best where

013985.question: Why do americans write the date in a nonsensical order, i.e. not from biggest to smallest or smallest to biggest unit of time?
013985.answer: it's based on the way it is spoken. the year is last because it is usually the least important in conversation, and the reason it is month-day and not day-month is because it is fewer syllables to say month-day. this combination of circumstances is what resulted in the date format. you might think this creates an imperfect logistical outcome, but it is important to remember that when dealing with computers and numerical sorting, it is done in the logistically correct way. have you checked out the file names of my archived questions pages, or the file names of any of the items on the notes or reality pages

014148.question: What other non-car tests do you do on your songs, if any?
014148.answer: a typical type of test to do is just make sure you are walking around the room while listening to it, on speakers. i find this to be good practice. a lot of people sit squarely at the desk, facing the speakers the entire time, and i just think you are missing out on how the song is really going to affect someone living in the real world. so it is good to hear it while walking around, in a wide range of locations throughout the room, not just 'ground zero.' walking outside with headphones is also a good test. as many different systems and places as you can, is always helpful. Also, a new type of test, which unfortunately is now a reality, is the bassless test. listen to your song on a device which has fucking no bass (such as the built in speakers on a smartphone, tablet, watch, whatever.) and no, you will not hear any bass, but it may add some perspective as to how to make sure the song still stands, in a bassless world, which weirdly enough is becoming more commonplace. and yet, systems with bass are still widespread, and the game is entirely different depending on whether you have bass or not. but you need to make sure your song succeeds in both games. It's like writing a TV show, but then when you're done you have to make sure the show also makes sense if you delete one of the characters. weird, but i guess it's a fun challenge. i have actually never really done the bassless test for a song, too afraid to admit its importance. but it is important and i will do it in the future. for fucks sakes they used to make records on balls of wax, and they liked it

014182.question: I have analyzed your song "New Canaan" and came to the conclusion that the song is about a guy who's going to prison and he's addressing to his daughter that he killed. My evidence is 1. you like singing about jail/prison 2. there is a federal prison in Pennsylvania called "Canaan" 3. the narrator is unreliable as he suffered a nervous breakdown as told by "I'm going crazy". 4. He's riding on a train (on his way to prison) and he's hungry for food and women (he's not gonna see a woman again any time soon) 5. He talks about "loving the shade of those license plates" i.e. he's making license plates, a stereotypical prison job. My theory is that he loved his daughter and went crazy before killing her and his nervous breakdown only got worse as he got sentenced to life in prison so he wrote this song to say what he wants to tell his dead daughter whom he loved dearly. As he's "talking" to his daughter, he feels the need as a father to protect her from the truth, and "lies about details" by saying he's "actually going to connecticut" At first he tries to convince himself that it's all for the better and that he's happy, evidenced by how he says he hopes the train doesn't get derailed, and how "the season is winter, and the sky is so blue" but gradually comes back to reality and understands the severity of the situation, as line "it's summer and the sky has turned grey and my dreams are sailing away" indicates he has spent enough time in prison for the seasons to change. On a scale of 100% to 100%, how close is my interpretation? P.s. I know you said you wrote the song after picking New Canaan as a random town to take the train and wrote the song on the way there. I just don't buy that such poetry would have such a straightforward explanation.

014314.question: Hey Bill, I've been checking up on your questions page once a week for a couple months now. Right off the bat I was fascinated not only on how you function as an artist, but in your day-to-day life, your "survival strategy" if you will. And you even give a specific date on when you stared making videos non-stop save for a one-week break! As an artist myself, this is very inspiring as I feel I've been stuck with a bunch of material written but not recorded. Like... what does one need to do to work on the level your doing? How do I engage this? Is it a personal event, or a simple yet sudden change of mind that causes this paradigm shift (if that's the proper term)?

014371.question: Hey, so I've been reading music for a while now, and I feel like I can read just about anything given five-ten minutes. But now I feel like that's a hurdle to jump since people in the real world may be like "no. Are you crazy? Ten minutes doesn't exist. Play this thing now or not at all" so I'm trying excercises where I just flip to a random piece in "the real book" and play it as accurately and fast as possible. I find myself panicking and stressing myself out doing this though. So how to not panic? Or is panic is necessary to do better? -Mr. Freak
014371.answer: start practicing with a metronome. take it as slow as you need so you can actually sight read it. when you run out of tunes, get another book -- try to get one with actual tempo markings so that way you can keep track of what your handicap is, relative to the song's actual tempo, and that way you can very gradually increase the tempo. also a good technique is learning to look ahead. i know that seems crazy but that is really how you get it done

014551.question: is there any way you can explain the key changes in this song https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=POfOycet4bE (except the obvious first one at 0:12)? it sounds like there is no key change from the chorus to the verse at 1:30-1:40 (same as 0:12-0:22) but i know something weird must be going on here because of the super surprising key change at 2:23, putting it back in the same key it was at 0:12
014551.answer: in general, the verses are 3 keys 'sharper' than the chorus. the verses are in Eb (or Cmin) and the chorus is in Gb (Ebmin) going from the chorus to the verse, they use Eb as a pivot point, because Eb minor exists normally in Gb, and if you arrive at Ebminor but then use Eb major instead, then that sets you up to go forward in an Eb maj key (or Cmin). going from the verse to the chorus they do not use that pivot point, they jump from the G7 (which sounds like it is setting up for Cmin) and immediately go to Bma7 (as b6 of the new Ebmin key)

014715.answer: i'm actually not familiar with the word auratic i'm not sure i really know what you're getting at i don't think so regardless of what world or paradigm we are living in, we will find ways to express ourselves. the results will range from mundane to magnificent, and surely often be both at the same time and also subject to each viewer's unique perception. i'm not sure if that answers your question. also after 400 years we usually only remember the good shit, so that's why people always think the present is lame by comparison, but it never is

014785.question: Considering how easy it is to install the youtube ad blocker, I don't think monetizing a video is such a moral conundrum. As to why everyone is bugging you about it, I think that they're placing themselves in your position and are a bit frustrated at the money being squandered for seemingly little reason. People are used to ads. The vast majority of channels have them. They are easily blocked if you so desire and it's believed that about 50% of people do so. It's money being thrown directly into the trash for the sake of martyrdom. I say this to clarify the position, so it's a bit less baffling that people seem to be clamoring for ads. I hope that helps.

015276.question: what is the longest question you've ever received? It couldn't be this one, could it? Does this question box have a text limit? Is this question too gimmicky? Is it unoriginal? Are my travels into meta-questions stupid and uncreative? Should I find out next time on Dragon Ball Z? Do you even care enough to read this? Will anyone else even see this? Is 1+1 really two or is it something stupid a first grader would say, like a window? Do you even care? Does anyone else who could potentially see this even care? Is reading this question going to prolong your work time, therefore prolonging the release date of HOTEWIG? Will you answer with a one-word statement like yes, no, or apparently? Should I go beyond the realm of yes or no questions? What even defines a question? What is keeping me from just pushing that "Ask" button, and quitting this whole question-making business completely? Why should I expect you have the answer to any of these questions? Wil l you re ward me for my valiant effort to make a really long question or will you let this burn in the depths of the bottom of unanswered question hell? Have many, many other people tried to do this before? Am I just an extremely self-evident smart-ass with too much time on my hands? Will I make an unnecessary history of japan reference? Will you even bother to give this question a green hyperlink? Am I too unsure of myself? Am I too sure of myself? Does this rambling tone sound like nails on a chalkboard in your ears? Will you link this in with the rest of the questions you don't understand? Will asking questions about what you might do prevent you from doing those things? Or am I overly forcing tongue-in-cheek humor beyond what it ever should be? Does being in on the joke make the joke any better? Is this what you imagine the worst possible question could be? Am I approaching the text limit? If there is no limit, is there a limit to how much of my effort and time I can give in to madly sc rawling these stupid-ass rambling inquiries? Do you think this is even vaguely funny? Or is the fact that every single sentence is a question make the whole thing sound like some sort of probe or survey? Do penguins have ankles? How many tangents can I go off of? Did these questions even have a focal point at all for tangents to go off of in the first place? Is this some sort of protection of my self image? Is this whole thing just big questions to myself, revealing the gaping maw that is my self doubt? Am I being way too edgy and self-deprecating? Is the imagined upward sound that signifies the end of a question getting to you yet? Should I care less about how I feel and talk more about you? Or have you already figured out that the only thing keeping this decrepit and threadbare series of questions going is self-satire? Is it getting old? When is/was a good time to stop? Has this record already been beaten by some idiot who fell asleep on the a key? Are you in any way stran gely hon ored at the dedication of this question? Am I retreading ground? Will you even read a single word of this or will you just say (or think) "wow, what a long letter"? Is my trying too hard the one thing preventing me from making a good question? How does one even define "trying too hard"? Is that even possible? Will you not post this because it won't fit into the webpage? Will you format the text so it's really teeny tiny so it does fit the page? Do you think it's even worth it to try? Would answering my question require you to ignore everyone else's questions? Should I care? Does it really matter whether or not you answer my question in the grand scheme of things? Is that metaphorically zooming out too much? Have you noticed that by now, all the random questions have seeped out, because I'm too tired to even care? Is this too meta? Is it really necessary for me to be asking all these questions? How should I possibly expect for you to know any of this? Have I just been runnin g around in circles for the last 718 words? Are you vaguely impressed that I knew how many words there were or have you just given up reading? Does this constitute an essay? Would I pass a standardized test with this? Can you anagram this block of text? Is this snarky at all? Have I used the word "or" too much? Am I asking questions for no reason or am I just very, very confused? Should I end this stupid thing already?

015557.question: i feel like you're very quick to put the kabosh on analogous thinking, stepping in with an implication to remind the asker that the subjects in question are not entirely alike at all, and are both wonderful and terrible in their own ways. You do this with common structures for questions, as well. I have a great respect for it, because it feels like you're stopping generalization and forcing people to look even harder at things. However, I am in a cognitive science class, and it is teaching me that analogy is fairly specific to humans, and it might be what has allowed us to advance beyond other species. We can apply learned information in a highly abstract way to many facets of our lives when we recognize similar structure, whereas other animals cannot. So now I am torn! What do you make of this?
015557.answer: analysis, making connections, categorizing things, ... all that stuff is wonderful, and i think it's an art, not a science. you can treat it as science, but you will surely run into trouble if you ever run into jokesters

015795.question: do you know what initially pushed you to start working on this video instead of working on songs?

015916.question: you talked about your 2 step program of first consuming content and then creating it. I've been stuck on the consuming step for years, and have been wanting to go to the creating step for a while now. I've tried a bunch of different forms of creating and nothing really got me hooked... how do you decide what to create? or even determine what you're good at so you don't waste time trying to create for no reason?
015916.answer: for me there were always too many ways, which actually made it impossible. there were always 100 ways i 'could' just pursue a career working for someone else as a side person. but i guess i just was too picky, and also crazy, so the only thing that made sense was to do everything myself, and there were always strong signs that that was possible because i have always picked up skills easily from a young age. but the more skills i got, the bigger and more insane the ideas and goals got. and i was just drowning and had no idea how to figure out what to do. and as time passed, it only got bigger and bigger and more insane. but i began documenting my journey early on, which sort of helped tie the entire struggle together into one cohesive story. and sure enough, after a few more chapters, and a few more layers of unmanageble expansion, just when i thought i was in way too deep to ever find my way, i just snapped and started a brute force approach which was to just start doing 5 'things' a week, ruthlessly, and never stopping, and posting it online. and then evolving the project from there, as needed, knowing that once it's underway i can surely steer it to hit every corner in due time

015990.answer: it really seems to be just D#aug7#9. i don't think the notes are written right, certainly Dnat is not in it, although it looks like that note is written in the chart. also C natural appears to be written but i don't think is actually in it, that would be a disaster. B, C#, G, F# are really the notes that we're working with here. also A could be buried in there somewhere but with the harmonica on A# you can't tell. and D# in the bass of course. sounds like a pretty standard D#aug7 (in the key of G#min) with all the usual suspects that you would find in a stevie sort of world

016005.question: How long were you documenting your journey before you started the 5 day schedule? How much of that documenting consisted of something like "I have no idea how I'm going to do this?" I only ask because I started doing something similar a year ago and I've thought that for all of it. Is there any advice you can give other than "wait until you can't take it any longer"?
016005.answer: quite a while that was a recurring subject there are plenty of things you can do, and try. i was never totally frozen, but almost everything i did felt like some kind of test or learning experiment. also did a lot of analysis, and just a lot of listening to music and watching things as well, just taking it all in and pretty much getting my mind blown all the time, and learning new things, which didn't help stop my own ideas and goals from constantly exploding bigger and broader. you might argue that 2009 was when i said 'i can't take it anymore' and started writing like crazy. but it was all writing and almost no recording. then i gradually inched my way into recording in about 2010, but then started writing 10 times more. basically i ended up leading myself into a place where i felt like i had already done centuries worth of work, but yet none of it was finalized or realized. there were many different times where you might say it 'all started' but each one was just another step. i'm not sure if that answers your question

016078.question: why is it that an ensemble with many instruments in the high range can often sound great, but having more than one bass player is often disastrous?
016078.answer: the harmonic series is really like a tree. the branches get smaller as they go up, so there can be more of them. but 2 trunks would really never work. play 3rds on a piano starting from around middle C, and get lower and lower. you will hear them stop working at a certain point. this will be about 1 octave above the point where 5ths would stop working, and it would be about 2 octaves above the point where single notes stop working, which is usually the end of the instrument (like around low A on piano, or in my opinion B or C) i've found that the harmonic series actually illustrates this exactly. you'll see thirds appear 2 octaves above the source note. so in otherwords if you play thirds in a certain range, the amount of 'mess' it makes is equal to the amount of 'mess' it would make if you played 5ths an octave below that. or a single note 2 octaves below. that's why heavy guitar riffs often use 5ths, and the bass usually plays the same thing 1 octave below, but in a single note. if you try to play 5ths there it just sounds like an earthquake. another interesting way of illustrating this is if you put distortion on and play 5ths, it often sounds exactly like a single note, 1 octave down. it even works if you play 4ths with distortion. it often sounds like a single note 2 octaves below the highest note. again agreeing with the harmonic series that your 2 notes are a part of

016121.question: i get this thing where i try recording a song (whilst writing it) but i keep just listening to the part i made because i don't know how i should move forward. and i'll listen to it up to the point at that i don't like it anymore. any thoughts and/or tips for moving forward?
016121.answer: after experimenting both ways, i firmly believe that i can get much better results if i finish writing the song entirely before recording it. not micro-managing all the instruments choices and parts, but just the melody/chords and other core details, and most importantly the entire road map, beginning to end. do not leave any sections in question. in the studio you are free to have much more fun with sound choices etc if you don't have to worry about where the song goes next, if that's already planned out. this is just in my experience. some people thrive on writing in the studio. i have tried both ways and nowadays i firmly believe that what works best for me is to write to the end first, before even touching the recording.

016170.question: okay, here's the situation. i am trying to listen to 1,000 albums of music this year. i am on track so far. i also want to release five album/ep's and i have each one planned. i am less on track with that, but it still seems feasible. at least, it was until today. today my piano teacher said I should be doing three hours of practice per day, and currently he has five jazz tunes (including one i have to transcribe) for me that I need to know inside out in a month, for an assessment. this would of course be doable and appropriately challenging under normal circumstances, but there is already so much going on, and i don't want to give up any of it. I'm already doing all but the bare minimum of schoolwork i am not passionate about (english, maths), and I don't play computer games or watch TV, but it just seems like there are not enough hours in the day. what is the best way to manage my time so that i can work on Multiple Projects even more swiftly and efficiently than I already am?
016170.answer: i'm not sure why you need someone else to tell you to transcribe tunes. can't you just decide on your own which tunes to transcribe? better yet, if you already have it on your agenda to listen to albums, why not just transcribe the albums you are listening to instead? also if it is on your agenda to make multiple albums, that is valuable real life musical experience. i don't see why you need to 'practice' for so many hours outside of that. if the piano teacher you mentioned is not willing to work congruently with your already established agenda, then i think those 2 agendas will come into conflict, as you have surely noticed

016412.question: you say you have written way more songs than you have had time to produce/release them. By "written" do you mean the lyrics, the sheet musics, or both? 016643.question: How did you write New Canaan? I found it really relatable while I was in the middle of relationship shit, and I always thought I sounded to me like a bit of a Mumford and Sons song. What influences were going on there?
016643.answer: i wrote it on paper, during a train ride from grand central station to new canaan, on may 15, 2009. i also worked on it on the patio outside starbucks next to the train station in new canaan, and probably worked on it a bit more while waiting for the train back. this is the original chart (page 1 and page 2). then sometime during all the writing/finishing sessions in 2012/2013 it got fixed up and re-worked a bit, mostly in the second half, to generally make it a stronger song, but still reflecting the original story, even adding some details that were not originally mentioned but were still true, such as the license plate colors

016981.question: did you know you were posting history of the world right before the ap world history test? (I watched it on the way to test and took it as a sign from the gods)
016981.answer: people started to tell me about those tests in april, assuming that it would be done by then, and i assumed it would be too. then as it got closer, i almost started to get stressed in a weird way, and then i got sort of upset about being stressed because test-prep is so not the reason i do what i do. if i did that, i would just get on camera and say a bunch of facts, not spend almost a year making the craziest thing i possibly can. so as the video was approaching completion on the week of the test, i was a bit torn because i didn't want to feel like i was racing to finish it for the test. and yet i didn't want to release it the day after the test either. it was very confusing and strange. the test was a very strange thing to think about, and it was very important to remember that that is not the reason i did it

017011.question: although i know you understand the seriousness, why use rape in such a joking context/manner and with the knowledge that theres absolutely so many youtube edgy folk that went "HAH RAPED" along the unfortunately popular current usage of 'rape' as in defeating somebody or doing better than them. this tone isnt meant to be accusatory i just would like to know where you stand on this, i love your humor and the effort you put into your vids but i personally couldnt watch this last one after the first mention
017011.answer: in the case of the scramble for africa, i was trying to explain it in the quickest and most efficient manner possible, and if you read up on the scramble for africa, i think you might find that that is a reasonably accurate one-word description of what happened. in the case of the rape of nanking, that is what the event is commonly known as, the 'rape of nanking.' i should also mention that i was heavily criticised last year because the rape of nanking was not mentioned the history of japan video. so i decided i should mention it in this video. i hope that makes sense. also i can't control what happens in youtube comments, unless i disable comments

017107.question: what part of hotewig took the most research/time to tl;dr down for us plebs? (whether that was learning about it or deciding to keep it in or out of the script). thanks again for condensing 11 months into 20 minutes
017107.answer: i'm not sure, but over the summer is when the research/writing happened. from about 2000bc to 1500ad i was going in 500 year blocks. i would just learn everything i could for every region, and write it all down, and then i had to basically just bang my head into a wall trying to get it to fit together. like a puzzle, and it had to make sense and it had to be interesting and it had to also be short. oh and after 2 months writing i reached the end but it was 20min45sec and still not 'good' enough, so during phase 2 (planning out the video) i actually ended up doing a lot of re-writes mainly in the second half, to basically make everything even simpler and shorter. it was a real nightmare to condense all that down. i was pretty much hallucinating all the hateful "you left this out" comments, in advance. but there was nothing i could do, i had to move forward

017865.answer: ah, that's actually a really good reason. here's my reasoning: i never had an icon or a logo when i made the website. the website was made before the youtube or any of those other channels. i originally wasn't going to use other sites. but i sort of got pressured into it. and all those sites are designed for you to have a profile image, so i had to come up with something. so i never really wanted to use the umbrella, i didn't want to use anything. i just came up with it because i had to use something, and that seemed the most reasonable out of all the options i had. so to use the umbrella on this site seems kind of like taking a step backwards somehow. i would possibly consider doing a favicon but i don't know yet what it would be

018029.question: I want to make a living off of creating abstract art, dance, poetry, and possibly own music later on (I don't currently have the resources to record good audio.) and posting it on the internet. Do you think this is feasible? I would like to try either way, but I feel like it would be good to know what you think. Should I have a back up plan?
018029.answer: if you really want to make the kind of material you want to make, you will need to find a separate way to earn a living. it might be handy to try to use your special skills as an advantage in finding a job, but if you really want to be free to make the kind of material you want, you are going to want to eliminate the immediate pressure to have it earn money. otherwise you will be forced to completely change what you do in order to follow the money, and it might cause you to be mad at the world. so i recommend getting any kind of work you can, and then in the remaining time work toward exactly where you want to go

018163.question: How important is music theory? How did you learn it? I love making funky chords on the piano and such but I also wanna know what people are talking about when they add a seventh or sustain a chord and actually be able to play it or be able to work with it. I've been studying sheet music for less than a year now but I still wanna understand things. Thanks for any help :)
018163.answer: theory is made up. make up your own, but also check in to see how it compares to the theory that others have made up. music works the same regardless of what you call it. but if 2 musicians are working together and they want to talk about what they are doing, sometimes it can be convenient if they have a way to describe what they are doing. that's the only place it comes in handy i learned music on my own, and over time i have been exposed to the various terminology, and everything always sunk in immediately because i was already familiar with what's going on if you have a c major chord (c, e, g) adding a major 7th note means adding B, and adding a flat seventh means adding Bb. it's like if you go up a C scale (c,d,e,f,g etc) and count 1,2,3,4,5 etc, it's the 7th note. which is either B or Bb depending on what mood you're in sustaining a chord just means holding it down. like if you play a chord and don't let go. pianos also have a pedal for this, so you can play the chord and let go but if you are holding the 'sustain pedal' the chord will stay on until you lift the pedal. very handy just keep doing what inspires you and be a magnet. every time you hear someone mention a thing, ask around to find out what it is. chances are it will be something you are already familiar with, but maybe called it something different

018218.question: Why is there no B# or Cb
018218.answer: there is. B# means C, and Cb means B. you might use B# if you are coming up a scale like F#, G#, A#, C, C#. but you can see if we use B# instead, it looks like F#, G#, A#, B#, C# it looks a little neater because we have 1 of each letter, instead of having no B and 2 C's and have to un-sharp and re-sharp the C. same thing the other way, if you are in Gb major, you might prefer to say Gb, Ab, Bb, Cb, Db neatly so you use all the letters in a row, instead of having to un-flat and re-flat the B by going Gb, Ab, Bb, Bnatural, Db. if you are writing on the staff, the advantage of keeping it scalar become even more clear. i hope that makes sense

018262.question: Isn't a sustained chord a chord with a 4? Or a 2? Like, the "Jesus chord": Gsus; is G, B, C, & D. Then a Gsus2 would be G, A, B, D (like G9, but instead of 9 it's 2)? Are these even questions? Also, yes, sustained can also mean to bring out in terms of length, but Wikipedia probably covers it better than a guy on the internet. Wait...
018262.answer: i think you are thinking of a 'sus' chord, which i think is short for 'suspended' but i'm not really sure i would call that G "add4" because you are still keeping the 3 i would call that G "add2" because you are still keeping the 3. sus4 and sus2 usually means you skip the 3 and play the 4 or 2 instead.

018362.question: Let's say you were writing something in B-flat major. And at the beginning of one measure, you have a natural on an E-flat in the left hand. 018362.answer: ah, that is a good question. i'm sure everyone will chime in saying it's one way or the other, but from what i've seen, there is no clear answer. that's why it's good to use 'courtesy accidentals' which is when you put the accidental (that's the sharp/flat/natural symbol) in parentheses

018478.question: Hey, it's me, person watching your videos everyday. So, I'm wondering, why did you bring up the sultan of Oman living in Zanzibar? It's pretty funny but seems unrelated to everything else. One of my favourite things about the video is how you make history into an interrelated narrative in which everything mentioned is important. But the Sultan thing seems super random. Thanks!
018478.answer: there are hundreds, thousands of things that happened in world history, so needless to say it was an insane challenge to figure out what to include and what to cut, and a never ending impossible balancing act. to help stay upbeat and sane in this project, i found it important early on to keep a very light and free attitude about the whole thing. people are surely going to get on my case for 'not mentioning this' and 'not mentioning that,' you can't mention everything that ever happened in one video. so the only way to really keep my shit together was just remember that this is a crazy thing to attempt, so just keep it fun, and don't be afraid to include weird things on purpose, just as a reminder that this is supposed to be fun, to hopefully distract from the fact that it is impossible to actually mention everything. the oman jingle was written in an early draft, and then got cut along with a million other things, but i liked the jingle so much i brought it back. trying to keep the whole thing perfectly balanced with an equal amount of details everywhere is kind of like drawing a straight line in a hurricane. at some point you have to just accept that certain random things are going to have extra details. also once a bit is written and turns out good, it can be hard to let go of. other examples would include the chandragupta/seleucis elephant deal, the robespierre stuff, etc. i had a hundred years war bit that i liked so much i was so sad to cut it, but there was surely already way too much britain/france in the video, and the first thing people usually complain about in history videos is that there's too much europe. so i had to cut it

018479.question: At what point in making your HOJ and HOTEWIG videos do you determine what's you're going to make jingles out of? Do you have an idea starting out, or do you determine it from the script, or when you do the animation? Thanks!

018811.question: Do you ever think about how bacteria are just made of chemistry and reactions but like really smart chemistry that doesn't have to just bump into other molecules randomly? So some weird stuff happened first that no one really knows (maybe it was like an enzyme molecule thing that catalysed a reaction in which another enzyme molecule is made so the more of the substrate it gets to go via it's reaction pathway, the more enzyme there is and then the more it can get substrate and then..) and then one day you suddenly have these bacteria things that are basically mini robots that are programmed to drive to things they can react with - kitted out with state of the art reaction driving and maximising equipment. But they don't choose where they go they just get dragged around by chemotaxis. But then chemotaxis gets really really complicated and the mini robots team up into little groups of robots (by accident) to make eukaryotes and these basically become ultra amazing jellyfish robots and it gets kinda hard to start to see where they're just getting dragged around by chemotaxis and where they're making decisions i mean could you call an insect's behaviour decisions? Then some filler and thanks to some handy processes like evolution and natural selection we get the next gen. supercomputer chemistry that can think and work with other supercomputers to keep doing what it's always done without ever really realising it. Because there was no such thing as realising something. And then the more they work together the smarter they get and eventually the chemistry based supercomputers learn what chemistry is. And then it's weird because the chemical system on a passive level is incredible at chemistry with a super fine tuned system but actively doesn't even understand what chemistry is and is kind of shit at it. So we're kind of chemistry doing chemistry because it means it doesn't have to deal with random stuff on an even better level and it beats entropy even more extravagantly than it did before - using the passive system, that took billions of years to develop by chance, to move individual atoms and make structures like laptops and abstract structu res like music that are too statistically unlikely and should never exist but if you go the long way around to making them by starting with bacteria they do. So I'm just a chemical system that become sentient? Is that supposed to mean something? I guess you could even say chemistry had to be made too from more fundamental stuff. Will AI be like the next level after us? cos it's still chemistry just kinda like it realised what it was and instead of waiting for evolution built a better, faster, smarter vessel for itself. If it wants - if we want. So the universe went from having no purpose and just random stuff to having a purpose. Because we want things does that count as purpose? Idk kinda rambley.
018811.answer: i'm not sure, but once you figure out consciousness, it seems to be a runaway train from there. and there is no reason to turn back, and i don't think anyone ever has

018898.question: if you dont know if something is jazz when listening to it, then how do you know something is jazz when you are performing it? (referring to your jazz page)
018898.answer: the reason that page is labeled jazz is because it's just opening up the book to a tune, picking a tempo (perhaps not even the original tempo!) and jamming through it with the boys. usually playing the head once through, and then improvising over the form. this activity has been called jazz. jazz can mean many different things but that's one of the things it has meant, and the title of that page is a reference to those types of sessions. as a twist, when it is used in that context it usually refers to a different instrumentation than i'm using, and it is a live jam between 4 different people. whereas i'm doing it all myself. but the activity is very much the same. especially considering that the first several dozen tunes i did were sight read from the Real Book, which has been a staple of these types of sessions
